TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Split . She was represented before the ORG by Mr S. Štimac , an advocate practising in ORG . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant was working as a music teacher in ORG in ORG DATE and DATE . She was dismissed following a decision taken by the school 's principal on DATE .
On DATE the applicant brought a civil action in ORG ( PERSON ) against her former employer challenging her dismissal and seeking reinstatement .

At a hearing held on DATE the applicant submitted a power of attorney which authorised PERSON ( “ PERSON ” ) , who was not an advocate but a teacher in the respondent school , to represent her in the proceedings . The power of attorney read as follows :
“ I , Snježana Delić , from ORG , ... , authorise PERSON to represent me in the dispute with ORG , ORG . ”
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's action .
Following an appeal by the applicant , on DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case .
In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG again dismissed the applicant 's action .
Following an appeal by the applicant , on DATE the ORG again quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case .
In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's action for a third time .
On DATE the ORG dismissed an appeal by the applicant and upheld the first - instance judgment .

Throughout the first and the second - instance proceedings , pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , the court decisions and other documents were served on the applicant 's representative and not on her personally . All the decisions stated that the applicant was represented by her “ representative , PERSON .
After having received the second - instance judgment of DATE , the applicant herself drafted and lodged an appeal on points of law ( revizija ) with ORG ( PERSON ) .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal on points of law . ORG judgment stated that the applicant was represented by “ PERSON , an advocate from Split ” . Under LAW , all decisions in a case must be served through the first - instance court . So , on DATE , ORG served ORG judgment on PERSON as the applicant 's representative .
On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint with ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) against ORG judgment . In her constitutional complaint the applicant wrote , inter alia :

“ Even though I had personally drafted my appeal on points of law and other submissions and had indicated my address , ORG sent the reply [ that is , the judgment of DATE ] to professor PERSON who did not serve the decision on me until a long time had passed because he did not want to make me sad . I consider that ORG was obliged to reply to the person who had sent [ lodged ] the appeal [ on points of law ] . ”

On DATE , of its own motion , ORG issued a decision rectifying its judgment of DATE so as to specify that the applicant had not been represented in the proceedings before that court . The decision on rectification in its relevant part read as follows :

“ Judgment no . Revr-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE of ORG in GPE is hereby rectified . In the fourth line of its header ... the words “ represented by PERSON , an advocate from Split ” shall be deleted .
The judgment remains unaltered in the remaining part .
Reasons
On DATE judgment no . Revr-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL was rendered by this court , dismissing as unfounded an appeal of points of law by the plaintiff , ORG .
By a clerical error in the header of the judgment it was stated that the plaintiff was represented by her representative , PERSON , an advocate from PERSON .
During the proceedings before the lower - instance courts , the plaintiff was represented by her representative , PERSON , who is not an advocate .
However , the plaintiff lodged the appeal on points of law herself .
Therefore , it was necessary ... to rectify the judgment of this court in the fourth line of its header by omitting the reference to the plaintiff 's representation . ”
The decision on rectification , but not the judgment of DATE , was served on the applicant personally on DATE .

On DATE ORG declared the applicant 's constitutional complaint inadmissible as being lodged outside the statutory time - limit of DATE , and on DATE served its decision on the applicant personally . In so deciding , it held that the statutory time - limit for lodging a constitutional complaint had started running on the date that ORG judgment of DATE had been served on PERSON as the applicant 's representative in the civil proceedings which had ended with that judgment . The relevant part of ORG decision read as follows :

“ The complainant received ORG judgment of DATE through her representative PERSON , an advocate from PERSON , on DATE ... The constitutional complaint was lodged on DATE , that is , after the expiry of the time - limit of DATE . The time - limit for lodging a constitutional complaint in the present [ case ] expired on DATE , DATE . ”
On DATE the applicant sent a letter to ORG asking it to reconsider her case . She enclosed ORG decision on rectification of DATE with her letter . The applicant wrote , inter alia :
It would appear that , on DATE , ORG requested the case file from ORG , which sent it on DATE . However , ORG never replied to the applicant 's letter .

The Government submitted that , after receiving the applicant 's letter , ORG had consulted the case file and established that the service of ORG judgment of DATE to PERSON constituted the proper service because the applicant had never revoked the power of attorney which she had given to him . Moreover , all decisions adopted during the civil proceedings had been served on him as her representative .

The relevant part of LAW on LAW ( PERSON o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of QUANTITY DATE – “ LAW ” ) , as amended by DATE Amendments ( PERSON o izmjenama i dopunama PERSON zakona o PERSON sudu PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) , which entered into force on DATE , reads as follows :
“ Unless provided otherwise by LAW , in the proceedings before it , the ORG shall apply mutatis mutandis the provisions of the relevant procedural laws of GPE as ancillary rules . ”

“ CARDINAL . Anyone may lodge a constitutional complaint with ORG if he or she deems that the decision of a state authority , local or regional self - government , or a legal person invested with public authority , on his or her rights or obligations , or as regards suspicion or accusation of a criminal offence , has violated his or her human rights or fundamental freedoms , or right to local or regional self - government , guaranteed by LAW ( “ constitutional right ” ) ...

CARDINAL . If another legal remedy is available in respect of the violation of the constitutional rights [ complained of ] , the constitutional complaint may be lodged only after this remedy has been exhausted .

CARDINAL . In matters in which an administrative action or , in civil and non - contentious proceedings , an appeal on points of law [ revizija ] are available , remedies shall be considered exhausted only after the decision on these legal remedies has been given . ”
“ A constitutional complaint may be lodged within the time - limit of DATE which begins on DATE that the [ contested ] decision is received . ”
“ The Constitutional Court shall ... declare inadmissible a [ belated ] constitutional complaint .... ”

Certificate of enforceability
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL )
“ ( CARDINAL ) A certificate of enforceability shall be issued by the court or [ another ] authority which adjudicated the claim in the first instance

( CARDINAL ) A certificate of enforceability for the issuance of which the statutory conditions were not met , shall be cancelled by a decision of the same court or [ another ] authority , at the request [ of a party ] or sua sponte . ”

Under ORG case - law ( see , for example , decision no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE adopted in the context of civil proceedings , decision no . PERSON of DATE adopted in the context of administrative proceedings , and decision no . I PERSON of DATE and decision no . PERSON CARDINAL of DATE adopted in the context of criminal proceedings ) , if a party was not properly served with a decision , the time - limit for lodging remedies against it does not start to run and the decision can not acquire the force of res judicata in respect of that party . In such cases , the date on which the party to whom the decision had not been properly served learned of the existence of the decision ( decision no . PERSON of DATE ) is irrelevant .

If such a decision nevertheless bears a stamp attesting that it acquired the force of res judicata , that is , the so - called certificate of finality ( potvrda o pravomoćnosti , klauzula pravomoćnosti ) , a party to whom the decision had not been properly served may request the court which adjudicated the case in the first instance to cancel that certificate and serve the decision on that party in accordance with the law ( see , for example , ORG judgment no . PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) . Such a request may be lodged at any time ( see , for example , judgment no . Gž CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG of DATE ) . A request to restore the proceedings to their previous position ( restiutio in integrum ob terminem elapsum , povrat u prijašnje stanje ) may not be used in such a situation because it presupposes that a party missed a time - limit for undertaking a procedural action , whereas in a situation where a decision had never been properly served on a party , the time - limit for lodging a remedy against that decision had never started to run and thus could not have been missed ( see the above cited ORG decision no . I PERSON of DATE ) .
